==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|不|知|火}}

===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|siranupi → siranuɸi → siranuwi → siranui}}

Compounded phrase from {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しらぬい|知らぬ|tr1=[[shiranu]]|t1='unknown', an archaic negative form of {{m|ja|知る|tr=[[shiru]]||know}}|火|tr2=[[hi]]|t2=fire}}.

===Pronunciation===
* [[訓読み|Kun'yomi]].
* {{IPA|/ɕiɽanui/|lang=ja}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しらぬい|hhira=しらぬひ}}

# a [[marine]] [[will o' the wisp]], more specifically one seen off the coasts of [[Kyūshū]] in the [[Yatsushiro Sea]] or [[Ariake Sea]]

====Usage notes====
* The kanji is a form of [[ateji]] commonly employed in Old Japanese and kept in this word, where {{l|ja|不知}} (more commonly read ''fuchi'', "ignorance; not knowing") stands in for {{l|ja|知らぬ|tr=''shiranu''}}. For more information, see [[w:Old Japanese#Writing system]]

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|鬼火|おにび}}
* {{ja-r|狐火|きつねび}}
* {{ja-r|狐日|きつねび}}
* {{ja-r|陰火|いんか}}
* {{ja-r|幽霊火|ゆうれいび}}
* {{ja-r|野火|やか}}

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|不知火海|^しらぬい ^かい}}: alternate name for {{m|ja|八代海|tr=Yatsushiro Kai||Yatsushiro Sea}}
* {{ja-r|不知火型|しらぬいがた}}: one of the ''[[kata]]'' (routines) performed by a ''[[yokozuna]]'' (highest sumo rank) when entering the ''[[dohyō]]'' (the sumo ring)
